comment: Overall, his class is really fun and he treated my group rather well, but I have a few complaints. He does not do a good job describing the instructions and grading criteria for assignments or giving feedback. What little instructions he does give reads in a very condescending tone. I implore you to take this class in person to enjoy it more.

My biggest complaint about Prof. Warpefelt is that his grading criteria for the Notebook submissions was extremely unclear, and it took most of the semester to figure out what he was wanting. He's a tough grader with the semester long group project, with very quick submission times - Assigned Monday, due Thursday.  Overall, he was an okay/meh prof

Henrik is a very caring professor; he even set up a private Teams meeting with me to check in on me and my progress. One group project from the beginning of the semester, 3 notebooks to turn in, and weekly discussions. He posts his lectures online and invites his online students to join the meeting in teams so you don't miss out.
Nothing to note. Not a bad professor. Boring class.

Probably one of the best professors currently at Kennesaw for Game Design and possibly even Computer Science in general. Clearly very knowledgeable in his subjects but does not try to condescend on other students who do not understand. He clearly wants everyone to pass his class and I could not give a stronger recommendation for this professor.

Professor Henrik provides many openings for a student to learn in this class. He allows for students to learn in a productive and stress free environment. If you want to learn about making games, this professor will help you do that. If you want to skate through the program, this professor will also let you do that as well. Overall, great Prof.

Do not take this guy if you can. Im taking his SWE3633 course and this is one of the worst professors Ive taken. 4 HWs, 2 tests. He takes his questions straight from the textbook, but makes up what answers he wants in his head. Ask vague questions, but doesnt want vague answers. Avoid.

Professor Warpefelt's course is just a copy and paste course from a few textbooks. No hands on material whatsoever. The class is easy but I learned nothing of value. All of the assignments took two months (the whole summer semester) for him to grade. The class is supposed to be asynchronous but tests are at mandatory times with no exceptions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Took SWE3633 online over the summer. He seems to care very little. Only 4 assignments and 2 tests, but the assignments are just based out of the textbook and don't improve software engineering skills at all. He's taken over a month to grade the first assignment. His class is just reading and answering questions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things
